task.text: Read this story and then collect phrases that describe what happens "We were halfway through the parade when our grandmother said she'd been married before, to the flag bearer on the World War II float. We asked her when. For a year, she said, adding that Uncle Mark was only our half-uncle. For most of the afternoon we thought of nothing but the flag bearer. Then Barbara said: "Who is Uncle Mark?"

object.name: The grandmother casually shared important information for the first time
Barbara suddenly realized she may have a new relative
The parade caused grandma to think about her past in a way that she might not have otherwise
Grandma is attending a parade because Uncle Mark invited her
Uncle Mark arrived late to the parade, but grandma was happy to see him
Grandma has only been married once
Barbara and Grandma have always taken Uncle Mark to the parade
Grandma was disappointed that Uncle Mark was the flag bearer
Barbara and Uncle Mark were proud to bear their flags for grandma
